item.title: Australia to focus on basics against India in second match of ODI series

item.title: Health, environment departments questioned 'evidence' cited in salmon antibiotic approval for florfenicol in Tasmanian waterways
item.description: Tasmania's health department and environment watchdog questioned the scientific rigour behind an application to use the antibiotic florfenicol in salmon farms, including a lack of evidence about its impact on humans, documents show.

item.title: Crown prince Reza Pahlavi on US military intervention in Iran and how a post Islamic Republic 'transition' would work
item.description: As the United States and Iran held their third round of nuclear talks on Thursday in Geneva amid heightened regional fears of the prospect of another war in the Middle East, Iran's exiled crown prince Reza Pahlavi says now is the time to move forward with military intervention.

item.description: Australian real estate now is among the world's most expensive, and that has made it a red-hot political issue as demographics shift.

item.title: NSW unveils sweeping foster care reforms for thousands of vulnerable children
item.description: While some child protection services will continue to be outsourced, the NSW government will play a larger role in the sector, including through the recruitment of foster carers.

item.title: Meet the mapmakers recording every remote road in Australia to keep travellers safer
item.description: Google Maps has made city driving a dream, but it's putting lives at risk in the bush. Meet the mapmakers taking on Australia's roughest roads to try to change that.

item.title: Medical Board of Australia to appeal decision allowing Dr Dileepa Jayaweera to continue working at Ballarat clinic
item.description: The Medical Board of Australia is appealing a tribunal decision that allowed a Ballarat doctor accused of digitally penetrating a female patient to continue working at the same clinic.

item.title: Women's Asian Cup hopes to change women's football in Australia — again
item.description: The Matildas' run in the 2023 World Cup saw unprecedented media coverage and crowds, and a participation boom among girls and women. Can the Asian Cup do the same?

item.title: US President Donald Trump says 'evil' Iranian leader is dead after US-Israeli air strikes
item.description: US President Donald Trump says Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has been killed in US air strikes. Iran's state media has confirmed the ayatollah has died.

item.title: Women's Asian Cup 2026: What time do the Matildas play? How to watch and follow Australia vs the Philippines
item.description: The Women's Asian Cup is finally upon us, with the Matildas beginning their quest for a second continental crown against the Philippines in Perth. This is all the need to know information, plus how to watch and follow the tournament opener.

item.title: Domestic violence accounts for 40pc of the more than 200 reported kidnappings that take place annually in NSW
item.description: Data shows that in the year to September 2025, NSW Police received 230 abduction and kidnapping reports — up from 224 in the previous year.

item.title: Minjee Lee and Hannah Green set for all-Aussie shootout in Women's World Championship final round
item.description: Australian duo Minjee Lee and Hannah Green share a one-shot lead in Singapore with 18 holes of the Women's World Championship to play.

item.title: Growing expectations Lake Eyre could reach full capacity for first time in decades
item.description: In the centre of Australia, there are whispers that Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre is experiencing conditions strangely similar to those that set a record depth of 6 metres in 1974.

item.title: Extreme rhetoric in Australia's right-wing political circles deserves more attention
item.description: The rhetoric in Australia's right-wing political circles is getting more extreme and the media should be paying more attention.

item.title: How easy is it to buy a gun in NSW after the Bondi terror attack?
item.description: Law reforms were swiftly passed following the massacre in December. So how difficult has it become to legally own a firearm in the state?

item.title: Calls to modernise Australia's surrogacy laws as couples continue to look overseas
item.description: Australia's complex surrogacy laws are under review, but in the meantime, couples like Alex and his husband say they are being pushed to look overseas to add to their families.

item.title: How on-campus university life has changed as studies shift online
item.description: Two students who went to the same university 30 years apart share their radically different experiences as lectures go online and face-to-face contact takes a back seat in the post-pandemic world.

item.title: Smoked crocodile on pub menu brings tourists to far north Qld town El Arish
item.description: Tourists are travelling hundreds of kilometres to the small town of El Arish in far north Queensland to get a look at its smoked crocodile.

item.title: US military releases vision of reported strikes in operation targeting Iran's supreme leader
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Bowling green's 'unbelievable' 86C temperature highlights need for urban heat mitigation
item.description: Drones are measuring the temperatures of common surfaces in regional cities and the results have stunned emergency services, with Mount Gambier's lawn bowls turf recording a temperature of 86 degrees Celsius.

item.title: Serious Tasmania Police officer misconduct allegations more than double in three years
item.description: Allegations of the most serious rated police misconduct have more than doubled in three years, according to police data, with complaints including family violence and possession of child exploitation material.

item.title: Australian in Dubai describes Iranian missile strikes
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Record rain falls in parts of South Australia
item.description: Heavy rain has fallen in parts of South Australia, bringing relief to some dry regional areas, with more expected for parts of the state.

item.title: Tropical low develops off North Queensland coast as rain begins to ease in flooded far west
item.description: Weather conditions in North Queensland are forecast to get wetter from today, but communities along the coast will be keeping an eye on the potential for a low pressure system to move toward land this week.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Bruce the bull makes appearances at Albany’s local bowling alley and pool rooms
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Brahman bull called Bruce shifts animal stereotypes in WA's Great Southern
item.description: Rescued nearly a decade ago by his owner, Bruce the Brahman bull has since grown into one of the Great Southern's most beloved icons.

item.title: New Zealand into T20 World Cup semis despite Pakistan win over Sri Lanka
item.description: New Zealand has made the semis at the T20 World Cup after Pakistan beat Sri Lanka but not by enough runs to steal the last-four place from the Black Caps.

item.title: Iran's Ayatollah Ali Khamenei was a staunch hardliner who mastered the art of playing his enemies off each other
item.description: A conservative Islamic scholar with a head for politics, Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei succeeded his mentor in the wake of the Iran-Iraq War — and consolidated his grip on power over the following decades.

item.title: Australia 'did not participate' in Operation Epic Fury in Iran
item.description: Foreign Minister Penny Wong has confirmed Australia was not involved in the major Israeli-United States operation in Iran that has reportedly decapitated its leadership.

item.title: Dom Aboud explores different cuts of meat
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Chef utilises whole steer and cooks 'funny' meat cuts to reduce food waste
item.description: Some high-end restaurants are turning to an uncommon practice to save money and hundreds of kilograms of beef.

item.title: Women's Asian Cup 2026: From Mary Fowler to Jamilla Rankin, here's your guide to the entire Matildas squad
item.description: You know the big names — Sam Kerr, Mary Fowler, Steph Catley — but what about the emerging Matildas stars who are looking to make an impact at the Women's Asian Cup in Australia? Here's your guide to every squad member.

item.title: Gippsland wildlife carer uses dental technique to save injured turtles
item.description: When turtles are struck on country roads, their shattered shells can mean certain death, but one rescuer in Victoria's east is patching them up and sending them home.

item.title: Iran conflict has financial markets preparing for oil price shock and economic damage
item.description: Global financial markets expect a damaging spike in the oil price tomorrow, with a critical shipping route for the Gulf's biggest producers now a war zone.

item.title: Buskers at Australian championships showcase why live is best
item.description: Musicians young and old battle it out for the prize of top busker at a national event in Southern Queensland.

item.title: Caring for carers: How respite services can make all the difference for those looking after others
item.description: Each Wednesday, Meika Robertson's husband Rob spends the day in respite care going on outings and chatting with others. While Rob enjoys a day away from home, Meika catches her breath.

item.title: Illawarra community centre programs to continue using $65,000 art sales cheque
item.description: The future of a community centre of social housing residents in the NSW Illawarra region has been secured using donations from a charity art exhibition at Sydney's Botanic Garden.

item.title: How eastern quolls, once extinct on the mainland, have returned to Victoria
item.description: Once dubbed the Australian "native cat", the eastern quoll was abundant before it was completely wiped out on mainland Australia.

item.title: Live: Knights end losing streak in Vegas despite devastating injury to young star
item.description: The Dragons take on the Bulldogs in Las Vegas after Newcastle five-eighth Fletcher Sharpe goes off injured early as the Knights beat the Cowboys to kick off the 2026 NRL season. Follow live.

item.title: 'Strong and resilient' stories of Goldfields elders preserved in Legacies exhibit
item.description: An oral history exhibition shares the lifetime stories of First Nations elders and their experiences at critical moments in Australian history.

item.title: WA government fights to keep current GST deal amid cost blowouts, seeks mining exemption
item.description: WA is desperate to retain the GST deal it struck with Scott Morrison as the Productivity Commission looks to rein in cost blowouts, and says exempting 25 per cent of mining revenues could help.

item.title: Attacking Iran is risky but Trump knows Americans like to win
item.description: Trump once proclaimed: "I am especially proud to be the first president in decades who has started no new wars." Now things have changed.

item.title: Twelve new offences added to Queensland's 'adult crime, adult time' policy bringing total to 45
item.description: Offences like unlawful stalking and conspiring to murder are among the 12 to be added to the Queensland government's third expansion of the "adult time, adult crime" policy.

item.title: Childhood cancer survivor vowing to live 'life to the fullest' after heart transplant
item.description: After overcoming cancer as a child, scans revealed her heart was "working under half of what it should".

item.title: 'More than 100 children' dead in US and Israel strike on Iranian school, Iran says
item.description: Vision has emerged of crowds of people searching through the rubble of a girls' elementary school in the city of Minab in southern Iran. Iranian authorities say a US and Israeli air strike killed more than 100 children.

item.title: Man dies after reportedly being washed away at Eurelia, SA Police say
item.description: Police say emergency services were called to the area, about 30km north of Orroroo, following reports a motorcyclist had been washed away when attempting to cross a flooded creek.

item.title: Severe weather warning in place as more wild weather lashes Victoria
item.description: Thunderstorms and heavy rain are expected to continue across Victoria.

item.description: As news reports emerge that Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has been killed, Iranians begin celebrating what they hope is the end of a brutal regime.

item.title: A Bali birthday and a mistaken murder: How shooting death of Melbourne father played out in court
item.description: Three Australian men are waiting to be sentenced after a months-long trial for the alleged murder of a Melbourne father. Police say it was a deliberate hit job, while the men say it wasn't intentional.

item.title: The US and Israel have struck Iran: Who has been killed?
item.description: A growing list of Iran's top leadership has been reportedly killed in ongoing strikes by Israel and the United States.

item.description: Reptile experts are searching for several juvenile freshwater crocodiles that have been spotted in a New South Wales creek.

item.title: Indepedent review of Inpex Ichthys LNG project finds emissions were 'systematically underestimated' for years
item.description: An independent review into oil and gas company Inpex has found widespread and persistent failures in how emissions were calculated, recorded and reported, dating back to the start of production in 2018.

item.title: Celebrations mixed with grief as Iranian Australians react to US-Israeli airstrikes
item.description: A Melbourne woman who fled Iran 19 years ago has described the US-Israeli air strikes on Iran — and the death of its supreme leader — as the country's "Berlin Wall moment".

item.title: Iranian strikes damage Dubai international airport and Burj Al Arab luxury hotel
item.description: Iran's retaliatory strikes have damaged Dubai's international airport and the landmark sail-shaped Burj Al Arab hotel.

item.title: Piper James farewelled by family and friends after her death on Queensland's K'gari
item.description: The 19-year-old is remembered at a funeral on Vancouver Island as her parents call for an inquest into her death on Queensland's K'gari.

item.title: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei's death may not lead to regime change in Iran
item.description: The death of Iran's supreme leader leaves a power vacuum in a perilously unstable country. It could end with a military takeover and a new leader with a no-limits approach to war.
